function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Using web scraping to retrieve COVID-19 data from external sources can lead to inaccurate or outdated information.","Impact":"Inaccurate information may result in incorrect diagnoses and ineffective mitigation strategies.","Mitigation":"Cross-check data from multiple reliable sources and verify information accuracy before using it for diagnosis or mitigation strategies.","Technologies":"Data verification algorithms, API integration for real-time data retrieval.","People":"Users of the application, healthcare professionals, government agencies.","Owner":"Developers, data scientists, healthcare professionals"},{"Description":"Dependence on a single website for COVID-19 data retrieval increases the risk of system failure if the website is down or inaccessible.","Impact":"Inability to retrieve updated information, disruption in the diagnosis and mitigation process.","Mitigation":"Utilize backup sources for data retrieval, implement error handling mechanisms to handle website outages.","Technologies":"Load balancing for data retrieval, redundant data sources, error handling algorithms.","People":"Users of the application, healthcare professionals, government agencies.","Owner":"Developers, data scientists."},{"Description":"Potential security risks when scraping data from external websites, including exposure to malicious code or unauthorized access to sensitive data.","Impact":"Compromised system integrity, data breaches, unauthorized access to patient information.","Mitigation":"Implement secure web scraping protocols, data encryption, access controls, and regular security audits.","Technologies":"Secure web scraping libraries, encryption algorithms, access control mechanisms.","People":"Users of the application, healthcare professionals, government agencies.","Owner":"Developers, data scientists, cybersecurity professionals."}]}
